title: E.P.A., Curbed by Supreme Court, Falls Back on a Piecemeal Plan for Climate Change
abstract: Last week’s ruling took away a major tool for reducing greenhouse gas emissions. Many regulatory options still remain, but the path will be more difficult.

title: The Strident Writings of a Young Blake Masters Dog His Senate Run
abstract: As a Stanford student in 2007, the Arizona candidate, now 35, chose a CrossFit chat room to express his opposition to U.S. involvement in World War II and downplay Al Qaeda as a threat to Americans.

title: Biden Promised to Stay Above the Fray, but Democrats Want a Fighter
abstract: President Biden’s measured approach at a time of political tumult has left him struggling to inspire his supporters and allies to action.

title: Fed Moves Toward Another Big Rate Increase as Inflation Lingers
abstract: As the Federal Reserve battles rapid inflation, officials are likely to stay on an aggressive path even as signs of economic cooling emerge.

title: Democrats Offer Plan to Cut Drug Costs, Seeking Climate and Tax Deal

title: Jan. 6 Panel Secures Deal for Cipollone to Be Interviewed
abstract: The former White House counsel pushed back on President Donald J. Trump’s efforts to overturn the 2020 election and was in the West Wing to witness his actions on Jan. 6, 2021.
byline: By Maggie Haberman and Luke Broadwater
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

abstract: Representative Mayra Flores is one of three Republican Latinas vying to transform South Texas politics by shunning moderates and often embracing the extreme.

title: Biden Awards Medal of Honor to Vietnam Soldiers for ‘Incredible Heroism’

title: Infertility Patients and Doctors Fear Abortion Bans Could Restrict I.V.F.

title: Will the Abortion Debate Keep Moderate Women in the Democrats’ Camp?
abstract: Worried about inflation and dissatisfied with President Biden, many moderate women have been drifting away from Democrats. Now the party hopes the fight for abortion rights will drive them back.
